intro: Gypsophila munzurensis, commonly known as the Munzur gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
